summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 discussing the technical production and stamping of documents for the US v. Epstein case. It involves coordination on copying data to hard drives, setting passwords, and providing tracking information for shipment, indicating ongoing legal discovery processes.

events.title: Hard Drive Shipment Coordination
events.description: Email exchange regarding FedEx tracking number and shipment of hard drives containing case productions.

events.title: Production Stamping Update
events.description: Vendor completed stamping of part 5 of the production, exported parts 1-3 from Relativity, and loaded USAO-SDFL files into another Epstein database.

events.title: Stamping Progress and Extension Planning
events.description: Discussion that part 4 of the production was stamped, putting the process more than halfway complete. Planning to ask Judge Nathan for an extension, with hope to finish before November 19.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from November 2020 related to the US v. Epstein case discovery process.
Technical details are discussed including breaking production into seven parts, stamping documents, exporting to hard drives, and setting passwords for the drives.
Mentions planning to request an extension from Judge Nathan, with a target date of November 19, 2020 for completion.
References loading data from USAO-SDFL (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida) into an Epstein database.
The correspondence involves logistical coordination for shipping hard drives containing case productions via FedEx.
